tasks.title: [NMA] 30-Day Review: Demographic Bid Adjustments Performance Analysis
tasks.notes:
From demographic adjustments execution summary (Dec 11, 2025):

**Background:**
- Demographic bid adjustments applied Dec 11, 2025
- 5 adjustments to UK and ROW Management campaigns
- Age 35-44, 45-54, 55-64 reduced to -20% bid modifier
- Expected impact: 5-8% account-wide CPA reduction

**30-Day Review Metrics:**

1. **Conversions Analysis:**
   - Compare Management campaign conversions (Dec 11 - Jan 11 vs baseline Nov 1-11)
   - Total conversion volume change
   - Conversion rate by demographic

2. **CPA by Demographic:**
   - Track CPA trends for each age segment
   - Verify 35-44, 45-54, 55-64 segments reduced spend
   - Check if younger demographics (18-34) improved performance

3. **Budget Reallocation:**
   - Confirm budget shifted to younger, higher-converting demographics
   - Calculate actual spend distribution by age group
   - Identify any unexpected shifts

4. **ROI Calculation:**
   - Actual CPA improvement vs expected (5-8%)
   - Monthly savings achieved (expected £400-650/month)
   - Overall account health impact

5. **Lead Quality Assessment:**
   - Review quality of converted leads (if data available from sales team)
   - Compare lead-to-enrolment rate before/after

**Decision Framework:**

- ✅ **Keep Adjustments If:**
  - CPA improves 5-8%
  - Lead quality maintained or improved
  - No negative impact on conversion volume

- 🔄 **Adjust If:**
  - CPA improvement < 5% but positive trend
  - Negative impact on younger demographics (unintended side effect)
  - Need to fine-tune specific segments

- ⏮️ **Rollback If:**
  - CPA worsens >10%
  - Significant drop in conversion volume
  - Unexpected negative impact on campaign performance

**Deliverables:**

1. Comprehensive performance report (Google Ads data + analysis)
2. Clear recommendation: keep, adjust, or rollback
3. Next phase recommendations (day-of-week adjustments, further demographic refinement)
